generif.text: These findings demonstrate that JMJD1A can be stimulated by hypoxia both in vitro and in vivo involving binding of HIF-1 to a specific HRE in the JMJD1A promoter.

Results show that many genes regulated by hypoxia and HIF-1alpha show patterns of induction with JMJD (Jumonji-domain containing)1A and JMJD2B demonstrating robust, and JMJD2C more modest, up-regulation by hypoxia.
histone demethylases JMJD1A and JMJD2B are transcriptional targets of hypoxia-inducible factor HIF

Immunohistochemical staining has revealed that JMJD1A is widely expressed in tissues, even in cells that are not known to express the androgen receptor, and is significantly increased in smooth muscle cells upon hypoxia treatment.
Hypoxic regulation of JMJD1A acts as a signal amplifier to facilitate hypoxic gene expression, ultimately enhancing tumor growth.
Data show that the JMJD1A/ABH2 family of dioxygenases is highly sensitive to inhibition by carcinogenic nickel ions.

identification of genetic alterations & expression changes of LSD1, JHDM2A & GASC1 in prostate cancer (PC); as no genetic alterations & only modest expression changes were found, it is unlikely they play a major role in progression of PC
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Jumonji domain containing 1A is a novel prognostic marker for colorectal cancer.
the increased expression of JMJD1A might be associated with the progression of kidney cancer.
Up-regulation of miR-155 in nasopharyngeal carcinoma is partly driven by LMP1 and LMP2A, and results in downregulation of JMJD1A.
our results suggest that JMJD1A is a sensitive recurrence marker, and JMJD1A can promote malignant transformation via epithelial-mesenchymal transition.
study demonstrates KDM3A is overexpressed in various types of cancer and directly activates transcription of HOXA1 through demethylation of histone H3K9 by binding to its promoter region
Findings suggest that both Ni(2+) and ascorbate can regulate the expression of histone demethylase JMJD1A, which is important for cancer development or inhibition.
KDM3A is recruited to the SLC2A3 locus in an HIF1-dependent manner and demethylates H3K9me2 so as to upregulate its expression.
Exposing cells to either chemical or cellular sources of (*)NO resulted in a significant increase in dimethyl Lys-9 on histone 3 (H3K9me2), the preferred substrate for KDM3A.
Our results suggest that LANA may play a role in regulation of epigenetic marks on the KSHV genome, which is in part through association with the histone demethylase KDM3A.
Data indicate that JMJD1A gene silencing abrogated the hypoxia-induced adrenomedullin (ADM) expression and inhibited HepG2 and Hep3B cell growth.
A single amino acid in KDM3A, T667, affects histone demethylase activity towards H3K9me1 and -me2.
Expression of JHDM2A was significantly increased but HDAC2, HDAC7, and SUV39H2 were significantly down-regulated in Systemic Sclerosis B cells relative to controls
JMJD1A forms a homodimer through its catalytic domains, bringing the two active sites close together
Studies identify the histone demethylase KDM3A as a new, miR-regulated, tumor promoter in Ewing Sarcoma.

data identify a novel pathway through which N-Myc causes neuroblastoma cell migration and invasion, and provide important evidence for further development of more potent JMJD1A/MALAT1 inhibitors for the prevention of tumor metastasis.
Studies found that JMJD1A was consistently and significantly downregulated at both RNA and protein levels in human germ cell tumors.
ACK1 interacts with KDM3A to regulate the mammary tumor oncogene HOXA1.
mitogen- and stress-activated protein kinase 1 (MSK1) specifically phosphorylates KDM3A at Ser264 (p-KDM3A), which is enriched in the regulatory regions of gene loci in the human genome.
Loss of JMJD1A expression is associated with liver fibrosis.
JMJD1A is phosphorylated at S265 by protein kinase A (PKA), and this is pivotal to activate the beta1-adrenergic receptor gene (Adrb1) and downstream targets including Ucp1 in brown adipocytes.
a critical role for JMJD1A in regulating proliferation and survival of prostate cancer cells by controlling c-Myc expression at transcriptional and post-translational levels
JMJD1A-MALAT1-MAPK signaling might participate in the JMJD1A-induced cell proliferation of gastric cancer.
These results indicate that the KDM3A-KLF2-IRF4 pathway plays an essential role in multiple myeloma cell survival and homing to the bone marrow, and therefore represents a therapeutic target.
JMJD1A could promote non-small cell lung cancer tumorigenesis
The KDM3A to PRM1 mRNA expression ratio can be used as a reliable marker of successful testicular sperm extraction in men with obstructive and non-obstructive azoospermia with 95% sensitivity.
Study identified KDM3A an H3K9me2 demethylase, as responsible for the H3K9me2 reduction and critical for breast tumor transformation.

depletion of KDM3A was capable of reactivating mutated p53 to induce the expression of pro-apoptotic genes in breast cancer with mutant p53. KDM3A knockdown also potently inhibited tumorigenic potentials of breast cancer stem-like cells and rendered them sensitive to apoptosis induced by chemotherapeutic drugs.
The authors find that KDM3A promotes anoikis through transcriptional activation of BNIP3 and BNIP3L, which encode pro-apoptotic proteins.
ormal stromal restricts cancer cell proliferation through JMJD1a-dependent modulation of gene expression.
deficient expression of JMJD1A/JMJD1A might be reflecting and/or contributing to round spermatid maturation arrest

our findings reveal a novel mechanism by which KDM3A promotes ovarian CSCs, proliferation and chemoresistance and thus, highlights the significance of KDM3A as a novel therapeutic target for resistant ovarian cancer.
In the present report, hypoxia is shown to activate a HIF-KDM3A-MMP12 signaling cascade that promotes trophoblast invasion and trophoblast-directed uterine spiral artery remodeling.
JMJD1A and c-Myc levels are independent prognostic factors for cervical cancer patients
JMJD1A promotes urinary bladder cancer progression by enhancing glycolysis through coactivation of HIF1alpha.

Authors show that KDM3A regulates MCAM expression both through a direct mechanism, involving modulation of H3K9 methylation at the MCAM promoter, and an indirect mechanism, via the Ets1 transcription factor.
Data suggest a critical role for KDM3A in the PI3K/AP-1 oncogenic axis and propose a novel strategy for inhibition of KDM3A against liver tumor development under PI3K pathway activation.

demonstrated that an essential target of KDM3A was a noncoding gene, MALAT1, whose upregulation contributed to acquisition of an antiapoptotic phenotype in multiple myeloma by accumulation of HIF-1alpha, leading to upregulation of glycolytic genes under hypoxia.
High JMJD1A expression is associated with lymph node metastasis in oral and oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma.
JMJD1A was found to interact with and promote the recruitment of HNRNPF and thus splicing of AR-V7 resulting in prostate cancer.
High JMJD1A expression is associated with colorectal cancer growth and metastasis.
The aim of this study was to screen any new mutation in KDM3A gene to explore more details of human male infertility.
Results provide evidence that KDM3A is essential for hypoxia-reoxygenation-induced NOX transcription and ROS production in endothelial cells.

Authors provide evidence that lysine-specific demethylase 3A (KDM3A) functions as an essential epigenetic enzyme for the activation of JAK2-STAT3 signaling pathway. KDM3A is tyrosine-phosphorylated by JAK2 in the nucleus and functions as a STAT3-dependent transcriptional coactivator.
Lysine demethylase 3A (KDM3A) is upregulated in myocardium from patients with hypertrophic heart disease.
KDM3A functioned as oncogene to regulate colorectal cancer cell migration and invasion.

KDM3A expression is correlated with YAP1 and hippo target genes in colorectal cancer patient tissues, and may serve as a potential prognosis mark. Taken together, our study reveals novel mechanisms for hippo signaling and enhancer activation, which is critical for tumorigenesis of colorectal cancer.
JMJD1 A is a co-activator of EPO expression
Acetylation of PHF5A modulates stress responses and colorectal carcinogenesis through alternative splicing-mediated upregulation of KDM3A.

Levels of KDM3A were increased in human pancreatic tumor tissues and cell lines. Knockdown of KDM3A in S2-007 cells significantly reduced colony formation, invasion, and migration. Study identified KDM3A-binding sites in the DCLK1 promoter. Levels of KDM3A and DCLK1 mRNA were higher in human pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma than nontumor pancreatic tissues and correlated with shorter survival times of patients.
PGC-1alpha monomethylation, which is dependent on oxygen availability-regulated KDM3A, plays a critical role in the regulation of mitochondrial biogenesis in brain tumor cells.
Histone demethylase JMJD1A promotes expression of DNA repair factors and radio-resistance of prostate cancer cells.
Opposite Roles of the JMJD1A Interaction Partners MDFI and MDFIC in Colorectal Cancer.
p300-Mediated Acetylation of Histone Demethylase JMJD1A Prevents Its Degradation by Ubiquitin Ligase STUB1 and Enhances Its Activity in Prostate Cancer.
Lysine demethylase KDM3A regulates nanophotonic hyperthermia resistance generated by 2D silicene in breast cancer.
KDM3A/Ets1 epigenetic axis contributes to PAX3/FOXO1-driven and independent disease-promoting gene expression in fusion-positive Rhabdomyosarcoma.
Histone demethylase Jumonji domain-containing 1A inhibits proliferation and progression of gastric cancer by upregulating runt-related transcription factor 3.
Cooperation between ETS transcription factor ETV1 and histone demethylase JMJD1A in colorectal cancer.
JmjC-KDMs KDM3A and KDM6B modulate radioresistance under hypoxic conditions in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.
microRNA-155-3p attenuates intervertebral disc degeneration via inhibition of KDM3A and HIF1alpha.
Downregulation of miR-335 exhibited an oncogenic effect via promoting KDM3A/YAP1 networks in clear cell renal cell carcinoma.
KDM1A and KDM3A promote tumor growth by upregulating cell cycle-associated genes in pancreatic cancer.
Spermatozoa retrieval in azoospermia and expression profile of JMJD1A, TNP2, and PRM2 in a subset of the Karachi population.
KDM3A regulates alternative splicing of cell-cycle genes following DNA damage.
Overexpression of let-7d explains down-regulated KDM3A and ENO2 in the pathogenesis of preeclampsia.
HIF-1alpha/JMJD1A signaling regulates inflammation and oxidative stress following hyperglycemia and hypoxia-induced vascular cell injury.
Histone demethylase JMJD1A in cancer progression and therapeutic resistance.
Histone demethylase JHDM2A participates in the repair of arsenic-induced DNA damage in L-02 cells by regulating DDB2.
KDM3A promotes oral squamous cell carcinoma cell proliferation and invasion via H3K9me2 demethylation-activated DCLK1.
Knockout of KDM3A in MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells inhibits tumor malignancy and promotes apoptosis.

BP.term: regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
positive regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
cellular response to leukemia inhibitory factor
regulation of stem cell population maintenance

name: lysine demethylase 3A

reactome.name: NR1H3 & NR1H2 regulate gene expression linked to cholesterol transport and efflux

wikipathways.name: Vitamin D-sensitive calcium signaling in depression

summary: This gene encodes a zinc finger protein that contains a jumonji domain and may play a role in hormone-dependent transcriptional activation. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Apr 2009]
